page.title: 04ST.WILFRID'S MAY PROCESSION
page.content: The first May procession started in St.Wilfrid's church in 1951. The processions are always in May because{ {May is the month of Mary.} The{May Queen }wears a white dress with a long white cape and two attendants hold the train. Four other attendants with long white dresses and veils walk behind. A small{page boy} dressed in white satin leads the way carrying a crown on a velvet cushion. The{children of Mary}wearing blue cloaks carry a statue of Our Lady while the{Guild of St.Agnes}in red cloaks carry embroidered banners. The procession with the priest, altar boys,schoolchildren and people walk from the church around the garden and back singing hymns and saying prayers.The{May Queen}then crowns the big{Statue of Our Lady}in the church.
